intro: Ebertia nana, commonly known as the dwarf snowbell, is a small herbaceous plant native to the northern regions of North America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features delicate, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine, hairy texture. Ebertia nana is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables.
